intro: Koanophyllon minutifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved koan, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Koanophyllon minutifolium is adapted to withstand drought conditions and has a low, sprawling growth habit.
